meanings.definition: Not provided with necessary tools or resources.
meanings.sent1: The explorers were unequipped for the harsh weather conditions.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic was unequipped to fix the complex engine issue.
meanings.sent3: The chef found himself unequipped to cook without any ingredients.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt unequipped to handle the flood of new information.
meanings.sent5: The student felt unequipped to tackle the challenging math problem.

meanings.sent1: The young swimmer felt unequipped to compete at the Olympic level.
meanings.sent2: The new employee was unequipped to handle the demanding workload.
meanings.sent3: The comedian felt unequipped to tell jokes without a punchline.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was unequipped to reach the high notes of the song.
meanings.sent5: The detective felt unequipped to solve the mysterious case.
